tO5YI9nBkj-tDcoGouymFA.text: Do not support this business! I called to make reservations on Saturday 3/30 for 3/31 and was told they didn't take reservations but to download the app to add your party to the wait. Sunday morning I downloaded the app and noticed I was online able to make a reservation for up to 6 people. My party was for 7. I called the restaurant immediately and was told "no problem just make the reservation for 6 and then when you arrive tell the hostess you have an additional person." The app told us the wait was 1 1/2 hours long and to arrive at 11:50am. We arrived around 11:35am to check in and was told that we had to wait another 1-2 hours because the person I spoke with gave incorrect information and that If you have a party over 6 YOU CAN NOT USE THE APP. I complained to the manager and said we were celebrating my Mother's birthday and had done everything I was told to do, can you not still accommodate us since your staff provided incorrect information. The manager was dismissive and showed no emotion and told me "oh well, sorry" I was livid! We decided to take our business elsewhere. Disgusting!!!

cBmAl4qdn1i7WR6Sfl9woQ.text: If I could give this place zero stars I would.  The customer service here is the worst and that's a priority to me when I patronize a business.  I was spoken to very rudely by the hostess when asking for more cups for the coffee.  While waiting for my table for nearly 2 hours I needed to take my son to the restroom at an alternate location.  When my table was finally ready, I explained where I was and would be there shortly.   I was ultimately told my table could not be held because other people had been waiting 2 hours!  Screw this place, there are too many other places to eat in Charlotte!

cBmcOpraAORsp6OQicADTw.text: This place has either excellent food and excellent service or mediocre food and mediocre, slow service. It's hit or miss, but worth the gamble when it's good! Everything is so eco friendly and fresh. Their artisan toast is always amazing, no matter what. I definitely recommend everyone try it.

DsLb82S4wft-EXDvMW847g.text: If I could give this place less than one star for their customer service I would.  While we sat waiting for a table 30 minutes a table was being unused.  All the workers would say is "you can't skip the line" I told them I was not wanting to skip the line - merely wanting them to seat those in front of us so the line would move.  We watched multiple parties walk out discourages at the fact that there were multiple  tables open and tons of people waiting.  At one time there were 8 people in another line just to pay their bill.  The group of people in the front seem overwhelmed and they are not friendly nor are they helpful.  Finally after an hour of waiting for a table - they sat us at two tables that were open the entire time we were waiting.

Lo30Nm0jyojCv9fkJXHYQQ.text: This place has the best avocado toast... the avocado and egg is a perfect combo. Great million dollar bacon. The cayenne adds a good amount of flavor to the already great bacon. In a great location and is a go to breakfast place if you want a great breakfast. And not to mention but the pancakes are absolutely delicious.  Always will come.  Jenna P

EqaYGyGgYn5dDBHIcTcg9g.text: Wife and I had a great time. Food was first rate. People were all very friendly and accommodating. Line was manageable but got much longer after we were there. But totally expected for Sunday morning. A bit higher priced than I usually like to pay for breakfast but food did not disappoint. I got the tacos and they were fresh and delish. My son got a pancake - very big but looked a bit overdone - not that the 6 year old was complaining. My wife got the Chickenchanga or something - also delish. OJ was fresh and the bacon...mmmm bacon. So I would highly recommend this experience.

zSc0wX1UAEcqfso_v8_aUQ.text: I find this location to be slow in particular if one is a lone diner, but the staff are friendly and the food is good. This was my second visit and it will likely be the last unfortunately. After a 20 min wait or so I was led to a table. I requested dry toast because on my first visit my toast was slathered in butter. The waitress clearly indicated my preference on the ticket today and of course when my food was finally delivered after a very long wait my toast was covered in butter. However, my waitress was nowhere to be found and didn't come check to see whether my order came out correctly. I had to flag her down when I eventually saw her. I really had no intention of being there an hour. She gladly requested that an order of toast be sent out which I never received, but since she still did not check to see if it arrived, I finished my food and asked another wait person if he could locate my waitress so that I could get my check. He actually returned with my check though he was not my waitperson. Today, was really disappointing experience. The food is good from what I've had but the wait is too long and it seems some of the staff need a bit more training on how to interact with patrons. As I said, it is highly unlikely that I will return in the future.

Hq5sicpsDlCjCNtpeg4Ymw.text: This was my second time dining here. The first time our food took an unusually long time, we were given free muffins to hold us over while we waited. We enjoyed our food. The second time we had Lauren as our server, she was nice but the service was not good. I ordered the market hash (all veggies) but I received the wrong hash, one with bacon. She did not come over and check on us once we got our food for ten minutes. So I had to sit and wait ten minutes until I was able to tell her the food was incorrect. We had to ask for water three separate times until she finally brought it with the correct hash.

zmasD0faE33Hy_urHO2OXQ.text: So yummy and consistent customer service! Our favorite food items are always off of the feature menu! Such creative ways to eat favorite meals! Ask for Bobby if you are at the Providence Farms (Waverly) location, he is THE BEST!

fTX-ZM-CP7h6uE1M11luug.text: This place has great option for breakfast, and healthy choices. However, the quality of the food is totally a joke l. Our ordered 4 plates of food and I can always see something our plates that's not fresh, or even rotten. Also those cups on the table, they are covered in grease and finger prints. Very disgusting place, I would not come back again.

xQL-XWrsiTPjVLfQ41Xlbg.text: The food is excellent. The environment is pleasant and the service is acceptable.  It is an excellent restaurant for breakfast and lunch.

ObDPmQdO6QFGwI7lKtRGkA.text: Very great food. Fast and accommodating. Price is very reasonable especially for the amount of food. The pancakes were a hit for the kids and the avocado toast was delicious. If you love avocado this is the best option..

WRDl0tvJtutjdEnDpzl7Qg.text: This is great for breakfast. The dishes are yummy! I like the blt plus egg sandwich . Easy to get in and get a table . Nice staff , lines are not long.

HFZpDh2owOIO6SG6ZGXFlw.text: Loved this place when it first opened, service was mediocre, and food was very mediocre last visit. Everything tasted the same. The toast and jam are always good. Very noisy, I recommend the one in Matthews.

ZOxetT_5JzNAgfV9VQjRZQ.text: I called in for an order for pick up at 8:07. I ordered avocado toast and a fruit bowl. I was told the food would take 7 minutes. I drove there right away, as I live 5 minutes away from first watch. I was told my food wasn't ready when i got there and was asked to "wait around". I waited for over 40 minutes and all of the employees seemed to avoid looking at me as I looked around for help. I ended up leaving hungry and unsatisfied. I Wouldn't recommend calling in.

i-fXTjIWBbn48Uhs0amU5Q.text: While I love the menu and the food once it finally arrives, the service in this location is horrific. My most recent visit had my waitress drop off our drinks and literally did not see her on the floor for 15 minutes. I asked one of the other waitresses for a cup of ice since my water was warm, and she smugly acknowledged my request but never returned with the cup of ice. Our food took a full hour before we received it after sitting down. The service was so poor, for the first time ever since high school (didn't tip then because no money), I gave my waitress a zero tip. It will be hard for me to go back to this place without change in management and service.

94yxvk6Zf-xvCMoHZv0kEQ.text: I've been here twice now and both experiences were wonderful. The servers are kind and attentive. The food is creative and delicious. Be sure to use their App to get on the waiting list before you arrive. It worked great for us on a Saturday morning.

zGqUgmuKCENkvonj1s3P9w.text: Simply GREAT!  Those lemon ricotta pancakes are to die for.  My all time favorite is the Bacado omelette and Cile chorizo one .   The only thing is that is always packed so plan ahead ;-)

0PHtAQ_O4iDMrfvjhtwJiw.text: Food was cold  Very busy place but also new  IHOP would have been better  Said to keep writing, so I guess I will or it will not post     Food was cold when it came out  I hop would have been better option

Nf0IZidxuw4rx_JfTNqsCg.text: I love this breakfast spot! There is always a wait though, so if you plan to eat here I would keep that in mind. There are so many healthy delicious options available. Definitely a weekend activity that starts my day off right.

TPsWTzQmR0iuFIdp2Cliow.text: Great food and amazing service. The traditional breakfast is really good and the lemon ricotta pancakes is what makes you keep coming back for more.

68CtdF9NAGS7t3PKR9XYxQ.text: We won't give this location another try. We used the app to add our names to the list early, given that we have infant twins who do not do well waiting for long periods of time.   The app said 45-60 min wait, and we put our name on the list & waited a bit before heading over. Even with that we had to wait nearly an hour after we checked in at the host station, it's as if they don't start the count down until you show up - physically.   When we tried to walk out; the host said we would be the next table, which was not True. 20 minutes later when we tried to walk out again, they finally sat us.  Let me tell you - the food was NOT worth that kind of wait. Not even close.

mP90Ur4jPXfx9ug9rVvoLA.text: It seems like Charlotte can't do brunches very well. My family and I tried First Watch on Saturday, September 8, to celebrate my sisters birthday and enjoy a great brunch. However, while I wasn't horrified by the food, I did leave disappointed considering the amount of time we waited.   Maybe I should stop ordering omelettes at brunch restaurants, but I always feel that one joint will finally prepare an amazing omelette. At First Watch, I ordered their Chile Chorizo Omelette, which came with chorizo (chorizo), avocado, green chilies, roasted onions, and Cheddar cheese with a side of seasoned potatoes. I have to say that the omelette was very bland. Even with added salt and pepper, there wasn't enough cheese or the other aforementioned toppings that added any flavor to the omelette. The potatoes were also served a bit burnt and were inconsistent with hardness, with some less cooked than others.  Not all is average though; the million-dollar bacon truly lives up to the title. It's well cooked with a perfect amount of crunch, along with a great blend of sweet and savory. I would've ordered two sides of this bacon as my main meal instead. The interior design and decor of the restaurant is also great. It felt very airy and homely, and of course it was very clean.  Overall, besides the bacon, the rest of the food was bland. I was able to try some of the other dishes my family ordered (we love to share), and those dishes were also about average. I would still recommend this place for those with strict diets, as First Watch (being health-focused) offers many substitutes for regular ingredients at no extra charge, which is rarely the case at any restaurant. For those who just want a great brunch place in Charlotte regardless of healthy alternatives, look elsewhere.   (For example, Le Peep in the Arboretum on Providence Road has the best omelettes of any brunch/diner I've been to in Charlotte)

Awnbog19hzKQ64R4uJvPDQ.text: The food overall was very good but management must educate their staff that Gluten free bread is USELESS and not safe if your going to toast it in the same toaster as regular bread. Buy another.toaster for Gluten free bread only. Secondly, when a hair is found in a food than hair nets should be worn in the kitchen. Certainly this location did not perform as other locations I have visited.

Az1g7t2Q0yZZJZXMT4FdGA.text: The only thing that deserves 5 stars is the million dollar bacon. Absolutely delicious. Everything else here is mediocre at best. Service was incredibly poor. Our waitress did a good job of taking our order as soon as we sat down,  but other than that she never asked if we needed anything else or gave refills unprompted. I had to wave her down when I wanted to order a tea because the water she served us was warm and had specks in it. She didn't even come by after we got our food, we didn't see her at all after that... and some random guy handed us our check and I could tell they wanted us out. We waited an hour to eat here, we should be allowed to enjoy our breakfast without being rushed out after 30 minutes. Food was okay. Lemon curd pancakes were dry, but my husband loved his biscuits and gravy. Place seemed clean until we sat down to our wet and sticky table that our menus were stuck to. No one cared if we had a good experience, we felt like cattle. It's a shame because the First Watch in Florida is amazing. I understand they just opened and I should probably give them grace, but I am not happy with how I was treated and probably won't be back.

pWJoynxr1rIrbrpbZsrIbQ.text: The Matthews locations is definitely much better. We tried this one on Providence today just for the heck of it, and the service/food/atmosphere were all off.  It was so crowded that I had people standing beside my table watching me eat as they waited for their table.  The food wasn't seasoned the same.  I was missing avocado on my dish, and I was definitely not given a full side of potatoes.  The coffee was not good at all, tastes like the coffee maker needs to be cleaned out properly.  The service was just ok, nothing great.  And when I went to check out, the little boy didn't even notice me there for a minute or two since he was so busy looking out the window...I had to eventually wave to him to get his attention, and I was the only person in line.  We will stick with our Matthews location going forward.

PePWYSYH-72WuKwSc0te-A.text: While the food is fresh and tasty here, the app and management are awful. If you have time to wait 45-60 minutes for the "10-15 wait (with 2 parties ahead of me)" the app promises, then you won't be disappointed. However, unless you are eating solo, your wait at the Waverly location will be 2-3x longer than the app reflects. It doesn't tell you that you won't be seated when there are 0 parties ahead if you. Who would expect that there would be a 20 minute wait at the Waverly location once we were "up" according to the app? Why would the management at Waverly have issues with the app (and blame the app) when the Matthews location doesn't? Since we are familiar with First Watch and using the app with other locations, we had an expectation that we would 'get in line' via the app and figure out if the wait time was in line with our stomachs' timing. I have been to this location solo, with my husband, as well as with my family of five and the results are only okay when being seated solo. I have gone to both the Waverly and the Matthews location and the Matthews location is by far better at 'guesstimating' wait times and meeting expectations.

xeYnHDtPyKXpXv3452plYw.text: I want to love this First Watch location because it is right by my house, but I just can't. I've gone a handful of occasions at off-peak times and find that the service has been awful each and every time--having to ask multiple times for water, orders input improperly by the server (or possibly executed improperly by the kitchen), and the food is just okay compared with some other locations. I've ordered a few different things--pancakes, eggs, toast, and bacon, and all of them were just sort of slapped onto the plate and were subpar compared with what I could have gotten at home. If someone invites me to breakfast and wants to go to First Watch, I will go because I don't totally hate it, but I won't choose to go back on my own. The only redeeming quality is the coffee, which is always exceptional!

goK6HyM6po8EHW7mJwp3kg.text: After driving by this new spot a few times, and hearing 2 friends mention having a nice meal.. & because I dream of  breakfast non stop like mike Tyson eating guys' ears..     Came in 30 min. Before closing.  The owner stood  near the door encouraging his girls for smiling on this blustery, soaking wet Hurricane Florence weekend.  I chatted with him a moment and they took me to a table.  Everything about this barn turned outside in is HAPPY and bustling about this place.  The music.  Atmosphere and people.     Since I'm a red blooded all American, of course I ordered the  Bacanado, a juicy fluffy omelette with stretchy cheese, Bacon  ,  , sour cream, side of GF toast- no charge and switched from greens mix to potatoes because I'm a fiend.    The meal was solid.   Huge pile of  potoates  Stuffing  omelette.  Jam is good like a Tom Petty concert!  Filled up this overgrown battlefield warrior..   Looks like I know where breakfast is this week!  I'll have to bring my 21 kids here soon once the inheritance comes in lol!

photos.caption: Photo of First Watch Providence - Charlotte, NC, United States

hEZ91iikwvukNCLdXCWwig.text: I so wanted this First Watch to be as spectacular as Matthews Township First Watch, but it wasn't.  The hostesses were okay, not "hey I'm so glad you came!", almost seemingly annoyed.  Our server, sigh...It took him forever to come over and take our drink order and when he did, he didn't get it right nor did he ever get it right.  I just wanted two more glasses for water and the coffee carafe and water bottle filled, that's all.  He did have enough time to spend at the hostess counter talking to the hostess looking at his phone.  Ahem, I digress.    The food was okay.  We all thought it was a bit over cooked.  The pancakes were super dry.  The coffee wasn't as great as it was at the Matthews location either????  The young ladies that brought our food were over-the-top fantastic.  One of the girls came back several times because our server forgot us.  She brought my glasses, the syrup, more coffee and water.  So I went ahead and gave her half of the tip I would have left the waiter.    We got our check from the waiter and he left and went back to the hostess station to chat some more and check his phone again.  We finished up and he never came back.  I had to send someone in my party to go get to go boxes (waste not....)  from the hostess station.    I don't think I'll be back to this location.

PKht-RzOKkHR6BGc61BWyA.text: GREAT addition to Waverly.   We needed another breakfast and lunch place and this fits the bill.  The wall and ceiling decorations are funky and fun.  The food is fresh and served up quickly.  Today, I had a frittata with egg whites and mushrooms and kale and tomatoes and cheese.  It was very good and was served with some greens on the side of the plate.  Also had a long piece of bread that was served with strawberry jam.  I had to request the strawberry jam and the serving size was a bit meager, but yummy.   My lunch companion, Deanna, had a salad and seemed to enjoy it.  The noise level is a little much here, similar to a lot of restaurants with high ceilings and concrete floors.  Our server was obviously trying to give hints that it was time for us to go, after we had finished our meal.  She brought drinks to go and asked us to take the bill up front to the register.  When we remained seated, she came back to the table and said that she would take our bill up there for us.  It came across as a big hint, even though she was friendly and efficient.   These restaurants will just need to learn that when I show up, it is for food and an extended visit with one of my friends.  It is NOT an eat and run affair!  I will return here.

E4EKm29-gRDaeunbe-h7Cw.text: My second First Watch location. This brand new one is pristinely clean, well organized and (although they're crazy busy) very efficient! We joined the waitlist -- what an AMAZING idea-- then when we got there, they went ahead and sat us. The brunch was delicious. I could've ordered about 10 different things on the menu but decided on their summer special, the Elote corn hash. Eggs, peppers, potatoes, perfect. Highly recommend !

sTLhvM1UUsDOlGIUvLFGbQ.text: Should be renamed; "First (your) Wallet. Absolutely over priced breakfast joint. Experienced a 20 minute wait for 2 with several empty tables. Service was the worst I've seen in some time. Took 10 minutes to get drinks. Food was delivered without condiments on the table. Had to grab another server for ketchup and syrup. Server says, "Ketchup is usually on the table". Thanks Captain Obvious! It wasn't, that's why I asked!!,  The food was meh, for an overpriced breakfast spot. This was our $37 order; decaf coffee, hash scramble, 2 blueberry pancakes, orange juice, Belgian waffle, bacon and potatoes. Waitress who had no clue, checked on us as we finished and asked, "How is everything?"  Really? Where were you 15 minutes ago when we required syrup and ketchup?   The size of the pancakes get 2 stars for the size. I haven't seen pancakes that big since the Copal Grill "hubcaps". Experience was really one star.   Don't waste your time or money. IHOP would have been better........

JgLeTs7Ps3Db6wuxI1TqNA.text: Just great all the time!  Book on app for a seat or wait is long! Love the food and healthy choices. Gluten free as well.

yerpj9AsRcdREDC8lsqDbg.text: Had breakfast this morning.  The coffee is great!  Ordered off of the seasonal menu.  Pumpkin pancake, egg and chicken sausage. Everything was delicious.  Service was excellent, very friendly and professional.  Liked that the staff worked as a team.  Will definitely be back.

QgCBzGalS5xnY4ufGk4ajw.text: I really like this place. Good food. Good service. There is generally a wait but they seem to turn tables rather quickly. Glad to have them in the neighborhood.

SfcYmozKK6ZGdVyilATX7Q.text: We tried to eat there this morning. After standing there for 10 minutes while tables were open and other people who came in after us were seated we asked the host if we could push two tables together. He then proceeds to tell us that is against fire code. Unfortunately he wasn't aware he was spending to a group of architects who design restaurants and are much more familiar with fire code than I am sure he was. We go there often, but doubt we will go back now.

zxrS7SNuM4SLZcbdthXIIg.text: When your no wait app says "no wait" and you show up and it's 30-45 min wait. Not ok when you have kids in tow and you're well aware of this feature so we don't have to wait! Super disappointing!!

DhHAe5YnjgCLbHsZqTB4BQ.text: I thought everything was going well despite the long wait until I discovered a staple on my plate of million dollar bacon. When I pointed it out to the gentleman who cleared our table his reply was oh, yeah we staple the checks together. There seemed to be no concern, so I mentioned it when I paid my bill and got an apology and an offer to speak to the previous person again. Maybe you should think about moving your stapler!

5V1P3Kt1MenXMtTdbET7iw.text: Greasy! I wanted an omelette filled with veggies and I am used to them being practically steamed and fresh on the inside. What I ended up with was a greasy oily fry of vegetables. The opposite of the healthfull meal I was looking for.

LyBwltdwboGL5n3doV7x5Q.text: We loved this place. We tried some brunch and it was amazing! We usually go to another place but we like to try different restaurant and we weren't disappointed. Food was delicious and the service was great, everyone was nice

X1HYrkf02e3veWDnJZLrhg.text: Just to make this clear, I haven't eaten at a First Watch in 8 years. And let me tell you that I am completely disappointed. Their waiting list system is just ridiculous. If said customer was to come to the restaurant without joining the 'No Wait' app, all of the app-using consumers get slots in the waiting list with HIGHER priority. An ideal system would work so that App customer and non-app customers alike both get equal priority as they get on a list. When I arrived at the restaurant, they said that there was nobody ahead of us in line and we would be seated shortly. Sadly, that was not the case. At least five groups got seated before us and they had the same number of people as us. Blimey! Also, the last time I had eaten here, the menu was just simple breakfast basics such as pancakes, eggs, and bacon. Now, it's just a plethora of organic hippie cuisine that they can charge us more for. Now, in all fairness, I understand that menus should change based on changes in audience, so this appeals to many younger people. But, now it's just saturated to the point of no return. One last thing, the waiting area at the Waverly location is about the size of a postage stamp. There are very limited brunch restaurant options these days, especially on weekends when everyone is sick of their weekday raisin bran. When building a restaurant, you have to take things like capacity into consideration. We were all squished in that little corner like sardines in a can. This is very disappointing, keeping in mind that this location is very new and they could have easily avoided this if the builders put more thought into it. We eventually after about thirty minutes left and went to IHOP down the street with no wait at all. In conclusion, First Watch is just bad.

p0Gu_VTlqAzKySO2_GWGQA.text: Great menu, unique items. Had triathelete, it was great.  My DD had a Benedict with green salad.  She loved it.  Coffee was decent.  Just hard to pay $30 for breakfast.  Ouch..

0ctlvV8_D4tLSjUv-tjIPw.text: First Watch is very new to this area in Charlotte and WOW was it amazing!!! I ordered the seasoned potatoes-- so good!! They were soft with the perfect amount of crunch every once in a while. Also, I would 10/10 recommend the cheesy grits. They were creamy and cheesy and delicious. My sister ordered the million dollar bacon and it was yummy if you like a little sweet with your salty. My personal favorite of the bacon was the regular that my friend and I split-- so crunchy! The bacon originally came out a little soft but when we asked them to cook them longer they were very accommodating and made them exactly like we wanted it! Another friend who was with me ordered the chia seed pudding, so good and a dish I haven't seen anywhere else. Also don't forget about the waffle my friend also ordered, so great and came with fresh  fluffy butter and a delicious fruit compote. Definitely go!

y9sO7xSWB9-neyVxSjqQnA.text: I was excited to try this new location in Waverly, as i had been to another location in Raleigh and loved it. I was so disappointed! Not a good experience at all. After being seated, we quickly felt FREEZING! There was cold air blowing hard on us, as if sitting in front of a fan. It was so uncomfortable. We mentioned it to the waitress, who said she told her manager, but it never changed while we there. Our whole party just ended up going to the car to get coats and ate lunch in our winter coats. The service was not good. Took about 10 mins for anyone to come to our table to begin with, the first 2 plates came out at least 10 mins before the other 2 in our party, and they couldn't wait for us to get our meals because it was freezing in there, they would've gotten cold! There was a dirty plate sitting on the ledge right next to our table that we had to ask the waitress to take away.  Just a bad experience overall. And this was on a Monday afternoon. Can't imagine what a busy Saturday morning might be like there.

CbZQCinLETmbbShDs400vw.text: Sat outside. We thoroughly enjoyed our breakfast. Got the everything Salmon Benedict and biscuits and gravy. Very very good!

LcmClEXmh56p9S80lXZPLg.text: Delicious fresh food! Reserve online before you head to restaurant so you are not waiting long for your table.

SCj5ocbqIJtinrzVw8UD9A.text: We've enjoyed the food here several times, but came with a larger group today of 8. They only have one 8 top table which is understandable, but the hostesses didn't think to push two 4 tops together for us. They told us it would be a 45 minute wait, but we waited for over an hour and half. The service and food once we got seated was good, but the waiting killed the experience for us.

CJG4JzQf5M7TBW-pix3Afg.text: First time at this restaurant for a late breakfast on Sunday morning and great food, service, and overall meal.  Really glad that they use the Waitlist feature on yelp as it only made our wait about 15-20 minutes versus 45-60 minutes.  I looked for it at their other location and but did on see that feature for that location.  High quality food and coffee (love the large coffee mugs and pot for the table).  I chose the lemon ricotta pancakes with lemon curd and berries and a side of regular bacon and the spouse had a special called rainbow toast with ricotta and tons of fresh berries.  We both devoured every delcious bite of both! Don't go here looking for cheap diner food at a cheap price but overall price was fair for the food and service.  The host/hostess graciously handled a large  crowd of people all waiting for their tables.  A sign of good management.

v9OTxdHIr5fjVDpfeJ1clQ.text: We used the wait list app, and needed a table outside, which I listed in the notes. After waiting for almost 2 hours we arrived, waited another 15 minutes, and they scheduled a table inside. Since we brought a puppy, we cannot do that, and now have to leave to go somewhere else, since the wait for outside is another hour. The host was not helpful and couldn't care less.

9D2AVvqQct3q_LYWenkgOw.text: Have you eaten at First Watch many times. Recently I had there pork chop and eggs and the porkchop was overcooked and very dry. I told the waiter and he apologized, but that was it. I'm sure I'll go back sometime but I'm rather disappointed that more steps were taken to deal with the unsatisfactory breakfast.

HjyxqaFZ_pnjxkDqhmWK3w.text: The hash was delicious, and biscuits with turkey sausage was really good.  Coffee is good.  Wish they had mimosas.  They REALLY need an awning above front door so people can wait outside without melting in the heat. That would also reduce sound and chaos inside. It's really loud (soft materials like curtains or fabric art could absorb sound).  Not a relaxing morning spot, but still worth a trip for the food.  They turn the tables quickly.

0xIbpsU_DihTklR0GX__NQ.text: The food is great here. The check in process in maddening. On line check in not accurate. We race to the restaurant when the app tells us our table is ready only to be told 30-45 min wait. The waiting area is overcrowded and the outside area has no shade, umbrellas and you bake in the sun while waiting. Waitstaff are awesome, food great but a hassle coming here.

Tx8ocbAtd6D28k5d7aA6SQ.text: Great new brunch place- I had the pancakes the first time I went and Mexican street corn hash (one of the summer specials) the second time and they were both so good

khtOx20Irso6SduTjCS26g.text: i swear to jesus christ my lord and savior that there will never be a restaurant that satisfies my taste buds as this one does so seamlessly. in conclusion, this shit slaps.

3ZEGtCuxlQeahzdjaDAWsQ.text: Loved loved loved this place. Our food was great. I had the Chile Chorizo omelet and it was nothing short of amazing. We also tried both of their fresh juices and they were great. The only reason I won't give 5 stars is because of the sun beating in the windows, which obviously they can't control the sun but they should really but up shades in order to make guests more comfortable. 90XRtTlgUlUfCPeZaf0efw.text: i went to providence waverly for the first time on sunday, 8/12 the wait was too long, it was packed, so i decided to go back monday morning 8/13, got there at 8:15, left at 9am, i live in waverly so i was very excited to go try it, i loved the decor, the food was good, a little pricey, my bill for just my husband and i was 33.50, had tri-feca, omelette, grits n pancake which was an up charge, the thing that got me upset was the girl that was at register did not have any type of customer service, felt she was very rude, she sat us, did not say one word to us as we came in, not one word as she seated us, and not one word, to us as i paid my bill, literally, not one word, nothing, they need to get her out of there, shes the type of employee that will kill a business, so sad but True, for the pirce of food there, everyone should be at least greeted in a nice friendly way, to make customers want to come back, i wont go back there at all.

5vm-QeYsYbZeR9YzBNT4kQ.text: Bad start to our first visit. Yes a Saturday and we were told 45 minute wait. While waiting outside the tables were taking a long time to get cleaned, customers were stating the service is bad and taking forever, the coffee station inside the front door was empty with the trash overflowing. We may try another day but not s good first impression.

GpXCN08SxiEYVC1n-F0ddw.text: Graded a 3 because food was a four and service was a 2. Hostess was not very friendly and seemed to have other things on her mind than helping us. They tried to sit my friend and I at a large dirty 6 top. We asked to be sat at the smaller somewhat clean table beside it instead. We ordered coffee a speciality drink. Got my coffee but we had to ask another server for the other drink. For food we got a breakfast sandwich and lemon pancakes to split. It was both delicious but no one checked on us so we had to ask yet again another server to get us the syrup. The other waiter even ended up bringing us our check; not sure how that works. Was not a fan of being able to see the servers hang out and chat while we are trying to get help. Willing to try another location for the food.

ioDah-k7lSv-lbWu1Gfw0A.text: YUM YUM YUM. I do love this place - but I DO hate the wait. There's always a line out the door after 9 a.m. and if you don't time it right you'll be hangry for sure. I haven't ordered anything but the avocado toast which is by far the best around. My 2nd grader ordered the crepes once and did NOT like them (they were a bit greasy tasting) so he requires some encouragement to go here and we have been working to order him different things (no more crepes) - he's a million dollar bacon fan, so that's something. Hubs has started to follow me and also orders the avocado toast. Not sure there IS anything else on the menu (ha ha). I love fresh - I don't like that they don't give you ice in the waters, but I'm sure there's a logical reason for it. Coffee pots sit on the table, which is great, but some mornings we need more than ONE pot.

rR9LIHp4jh7LILGtJd_1sg.text: The food is great, fresh food made to order.  It's one of the best breakfast/brunch spots in the area.  Highly recommend this place!

5pNpvgWiL0Q7Y9ms6tyxqQ.text: Just sat down at First Watch in Waverly for the first time.  The menu looks very interesting with lots of healthy and not so healthy choices.  I'm giving the restaurant a one star rating before I even get my food because of the service.  When asked for a simple straw we were told "to bad so sad" by the server.  When I go to an establishment and pay $50 for breakfast I don't want any political commentary on whether or not I use a straw.  If you think straws will be the end of the earth than you should serve paper straws and not plastic straws.  Eventually, we received our straws, but felt like we were the dregs of the day universe for asking.  As an aside, we tried to go to the Matthews location on Sunday.  I downloaded the app and used their "waiting in line" option so we could be place on their list.  The app said at that moment there was a twenty minute wait which was great.  Upon arrival, we were told even though we were already on their list it would be an hour wait.  Not good!!  We left and went to a very good breakfast restaurant located in the Arboretum by the Firestone store.  Got in and seated in five minutes and had excellent food.  Just sayin'.

rxvw6hOyRyQmzpsvVeYcnQ.text: No one knows about the app, waited 1hr and 15 to minutes to be seated, and then waited another hour to get our food, and the ac doesn't seem to be working. For a brand new place this place is going down hill.  Feel like they need a better system!

oMY9_-UXr1N-dMoE3EW97A.text: This restaurant has delicious, crafty food items that are well worth the price range and the wait. It's a busy restaurant so there's often a wait to be seated but it's well worth the wait - it's busy for a reason. I come back as often as I can. The food is amazing but the staff? Ashkim and Kim and Caroline and everyone else whose names I may have forgotten or misspelled are amazing and so sweet and always make sure we are cared for. 10/10 would visit every day if I could.

cTU3mPUNGt1SXpDw6Xqemg.text: My favorite breakfast place.  The food is always good and fresh.  Went their first thing Sunday morning. Hubby got "The Works"  he said it was delicious omelet filled with sausage,  peppers, cheese etc.  you get it the works.  I got the "hacienda hash"  it was delicious, potatoes on the bottom with chorizo, peppers, cheese, drizzled with crema, and two dollops or guacamole and two over easy eggs on top.  It won't disappoint I promise.   I suggest you get the app so that you can reserve your place in line.  We just waited about 5 minutes and where seated.  Other people coming in had about a 25 minute wait.

8FVa536LJUoaC9_5yvb3NQ.text: We went here this morning for the first time and we will definitely be back! The decor is so cute, it has a laid-back, welcoming environment and the food was delicious. The eggs Benedict was good (the eggs were a little more cooked than usual, so if you want a tinnier yolk, maybe ask for it), and the banana crunch pancake was delicious, although my husband was happy he ordered two eggs on the side. The only reason for the lower rating was that halfway through my meal I found a long hair that kind of ruined the rest of my experience. I'm still willing to come back and give this place another try though.

t-g5mMP0qR0oGfYOWX2eWg.text: This is our regular location.  Service is great. Even the 1x I've had to send back because there was a hair in my food the service has been great.   Even better since they've added the ability to see what wait times are & add yourself to the wait list.  Fabulous feature.   I'm a fan of the avocado toast! Love the amount of avocado like 1 whole avocado on each side of the toast w/a light finish of oil.  The basted eggs are wonderful.  They are like a poached egg & a little firmer than a sunnyside up but still that yummy runny yolk.   Pumpkin pancakes special for the season was a subtle flavor that still mixed well w/maple syrup.   Love the concept of all wholesome type of food :)

kFRzG_TtJpn5ugyHko0NWA.text: This is definitely my families favorite breakfast place. Being able use the app to add your name to the waitlist is the only way to go, especially on the weekends. The service can be amazing or inattentive. Bobby and Carolyn are particularly excellent and always a delight. The food is interesting, varied and pretty consistent for the most part.

w_Qzz71V76EKnj2GdJ0LSg.text: Disappointing. This was our first time here, and we had heard good things about the place, so we were really looking forward to our time here. Initial impression were all positive: clean, inviting atmosphere, and a constant flow of people coming in the doors.  We had a friendly server who suggested the seasonal pumpkin pancakes, which I ordered, while my spouse ordered Floridian French toast. After that, everything went down hill.  While waiting for breakfast to come, we had some coffee, but the entire tray of coffee creamer on the table was flavored, so we had to wait for our server to get regular cream, and throw out the coffee I had already poured with the flavored cream. Breakfast came, and the French toast bread was undercooked and tasted "doughy". Actually side order of 'million dollar bacon', also very undercooked, was anything but appetizing. The restaurant is real big on farm fresh and healthy choices. The orange juice was fresh squeezed, but it still seemed like it was lacking, as if it was diluted.  Finally, it was time to pay or bill. The pay counter is purely situated so that there is virtually no privacy from people coming in the front door and waiting. Worse, the pay location is right on the main aisle to the kitchen. While waiting second in line, I was bumped into from people at the table nearest the register behind me , and bumped into no less than five times by staff going to and fro the kitchen. I was in the way no matter where I stood. A horrible setup. It was then my turn to pay, and the cashier asked how our experience was. I said, "not so good." He didn't bother to inquire further and didn't seem to care. I then explained that the pay line is poorly designed and I was constantly in the way. I suggested they move the register back as there was plenty of room behind him. Again not much response.  A lot of hype about a new local restaurant. Much ado about nothing. Substandard quality food and pricey. This place isn't a big deal. There are better are more reasonable priced places nearby. No desire to return.

sQFb-v4O_JKhCxYLvFiKRg.text: I'm a first timer, but will return. Great food and service.  If they don't have it, you don't need it

xKDXV6aMeM8DfFzNPp8erg.text: BE PREPARED TO WAIT. AND WAIT. AND WAIT. We've been to this First Watch probably 5 times now. There's always a wait to get a table but that is understandable because the food is good and it's a prime location. We've sat at the community table to avoid this or run errands close by (they say they won't hold your table more than 3 minutes though).   What frustrates me the most is that even if you order right away, you still won't get your food for 30 minutes. Sometimes you'll get seated and be completely forgetten - I've had to wave my hands to someone to get a waitress before. Thankfully that didn't happen on our latest visit because we had already waited over an hour for our table. We ordered as soon as the waitress brought our water and then waited. And waited. And waited. The food FINALLY showed up after about 30 minutes. The place was not no longer at full capacity by the time we were seated but regardless, it boggles my mind that it takes 30 minutes for a restaurant to make breakfast food.   The other thing that disappoints me a little are the side options. The potatoes are only cooked (albeit golden) on one side so the texture isn't my favorite - they feel so dry in your mouth. I often sub them for the greens but lately there have been too many bitter red greens in the mix. I've asked for other options and was told I could get grits. Why not fruit? Another disappointment was the strawberries on our lemon ricotta pancake seemed like they'd been cut and stored several days ago. They were mushy and dull.  My husband said his chickichanga was good but he didn't taste any chorizo or spiciness from it.  The reason I pay this much to receive super-slow moderately-friendly service for breakfast food is because the elevated egg sandwich is so good. Sometimes the egg is super runny, and sometimes it's firm but either way I love it (mushy egg would be perfection!).   The ambiance is good and definitely a draw. It's always very cold inside in the summer (bring a sweater!) On the latest visit our table and chairs were dirty (looked like the last customer spilled makeup all over the seat so I'm glad I looked before sitting).  Our waitress did ask if everything was OK, and it was. It was good. Nothing was bad enough to be worth complaining about, especially when you're an hour and a half in and ready to get on with your day. I just wish they could figure out how to improve efficiency. If they did I'd be tempted to go there a lot more often.

uSS39eM5FroFP8XaNi5ozw.text: Basically restaurant caters to family of four or less? They only have one or two tables for family of more than 4. Checked in only an hour ago and then went to restaurant and waited 1/2 hour+ because they only have one or two tables that can fit parties of more than 4!!  Finally sat down to eat and found bacon under the table. Not to mention it took 45 mins to get our food! Order of pancakes came without syrup and had to ask for it multiple times before we received it. Last order of pancake didn't even come until everyone finished eating because apparently it "went to the wrong table". Can they get anything right? I basically spent nearly 3 hours of my life to eat at this place. Never again!

Ydgbzhy8IlNepKo3wyYJmQ.text: Very disappointing experience with this location. Problems with check in process as well as attitude from hostess. Food took a while after our hour and ten min wait. Promised wait time was 25-45 mins. Hostess staff didn't follow procedure at check in and never contacted us. Wouldn't trust the app. Manager handled the situation but we wasted a large portion of our morning already. Server was polite and friendly

QQLoxMa3ZUK7QD5yw4JkAg.text: Place continues to get worse. Ordered take out. Asked multiple times to add a drink. Food was ready on time but only gave us one drink. That's ok people mess up orders but... then when I said I ordered two drinks they said but it only says one. I then repeated and yes but I ordered extra can it have another drink. I had to pay for the extra drinks even tho I was there fault. Cashiers didn't know how to place a simple drink order. They said I'll need a server. What? So 20 minutes later the cashiers then say, "hi do you need help paying". They completely forgot that I had asked for a drink. There response was "oh right. It's you". Five minutes later finally got my drink. I love the food but absolutely tired of my experience with the staff.

T3Q6ssw57bCh31KFLTkSSQ.text: This was our second visit to this location - with the first visit being on a VERY busy Saturday - and it was great.    This last visit though dropped the rating down tremendously.  I went with my wife on a Thursday Morning and were seated fairly quickly as the place wasn't busy.  We sat there for over 10 minutes before I got up and asked if someone was going to help us.  We were finally waited on, and I got coffee and my wife got water.  They bring the coffee out in a stainless steel carafe and the water in a little glass bottle that resembles the old milkman jugs.  I poured some water into 2 cups, but stopped my wife from drinking it as there was junk floating around it.  I figured it was the glass - so I got a new cup from the table and same thing.  I looked in the water jug - paper and green things were floating - it was a very high turbidity amount as well.  We did not see any one for a while so I flagged down a different waitress who apologized and went to get us a new jug.  My wife just went to get her water out of the car at this point - which was a good thing since the next jug also has stuff floating in it.  Barf!  Our food came out and this is the disappointing part - the food is good.  I ordered eggs, chicken sausage (really good stuff), grits and this multigrain toast that's wonderful.  My wife ordered a kids pancake and bacon - since the pancake is 10" and thick.  When my wife went to check out and use a BOGO - they said it wouldn't work for a kids pancake...but it would have worked for a more expensive pancake meal....so that was just the nice ending of a customer service nightmare.    Food - 4 or 5 stars Service - 1 star Water - 0 stars

fR3u1oKBA-rrCnWPyB0Ebw.text: I'm excited to have First Watch opened here. It's one of my favorite cafe to go for breakfast/brunch when I lived in Cincinnati, Ohio. However, my breakfast order, The Egg Benedict with tomato and avocado on a toasted ciabatta, was not impressive at all. They was bland and the poached eggs were not poached nicely. The yellow eggs are too runny, not as thick as it should be.

BdOh7KucWJ4_lG2xdquuhA.text: This is my "go-to" breakfast joint!  If you don't come early enough expect to wait a bit for your table!  The food is amazing for breakfast!  I usually forgo the coffee and order their juices instead!  The clan loves the million dollar bacon!  I'm a big fan of the avocado toast.  The house potatoes are great!  We always have to order extra because it goes pretty quick on our table.   If I could, I would be here every weekend for breakfast!  Unfortunately, we have frequented the location so often my clan is wanting to try other places!  I highly recommend trying out First Watch!  Believe there's a location in Matthews also.

KdTGd5olBrE3cuUGl8ngPw.text: Excellent first time here and it's now a favorite spot. Yummy biscuits and turkey gravy , the awesome server gave up a lemon ricotta pancake to try it was yummy also I could go on and on I a big fan now

mCacG-Vg4BHIRMc1kzCMVA.text: The Yelp waitlist sign-in for FWatch is not accurate at all. It's showing 1/2 hr but here it's a ONE-AND-A-HALF-HOUR wait n ppl r corralled in the small front area breathing in deep sighs. We were lucky to race in when we did n got to the reception thru the mass. Ppl came in groups wanting booths or singular tables while we didn't care if we sat on the communal, long, high table so we didn't hv to wait at all really but space was tight.  Waitress came, gave us coffee n took our order. Just a lil disappointed she forgot to bring more regular cream so we asked the ppl next to us. She never brought any while we hv this huge container to drink? Don't feel like bothering our neighbors again. They might want to use their stash, too.   Ordered the Harvest specials of Pumpkin Pancake Breakfast n Heritage Pork Chop n Eggs. Will post more after ...  Loved the melted, crusted cheesey topping of the HPCE grits n loved the sausage patty that came with the PPB. But, for a $30.05 breakfast for two, I thought it too pricey for the servings were stark; the pork chop very salty n not "tasty"; the ONE pumpkin pancake void of specialty zing/tang; badly washed utensils; and, table condiments needing a wipe down.   Having had an international hotel career, in the F&B and Marketing sector, what we are charged for should reflect the level we deserve, don't you agree?  They underestimated the restaurant space as well since it could not accompany all those customers corralled at the front reception for 1 1/2 hours. It really shouldn't be like that. Deceivingly, there were so many open parking spaces which makes one think zip in, zip out. Nope.   Hmm, I don't know if I'd eat here on weekends.  I'd like to be open minded, trying weekdays when it's less crowded since I hvn't tried other dishes.

_pMlHRECdUM4zthT5feS5g.text: This place is ALWAYS packed and for good reason! Everything I've tried has been delicious!  I love the unique menu options, but also that there are clean/healthy options as well! Their summer menu acai bowl is incredible, and their egg white omelette (pictured) is to die for. I also recommend getting their homemade toast with almond butter and strawberry jam. You won't regret it!!   If you're a coffee fan, their vanilla iced coffee is delicious! If you like your coffee on the stronger side, ask for less cream!

photos.caption: Photo of First Watch Providence - Charlotte, NC, United States. Egg white omelette with a side of fruit and toast!

-N0_g-B5WNHR9jk6E-2XdQ.text: Today's visit was our first time trying this place out for breakfast as our usual spot was closed. I checked in on Yelp as I saw the wait time varied between 35-60 minutes. Upon arrival, our party of 5 adults plus 1 child continued to wait about 40 minutes after checking in.   After waiting some time, a few of us went inside to grab coffee but the carafe was out. I ended up checking on our wait time since it had already been about 30 minutes from when we had checked in with the hostess on our arrival. The hostess responded that she didn't know how much longer and then said it would be another 30 minutes.   When we were seated, there was one coffee mug and water glass for the table of 5 adults and one child. We mentioned to the waiter we were ready for coffee, water, and for him to take our order when he arrived since the wait was longer than anticipated.   The place was packed and the service undoubtedly suffered. It took awhile to get coffee for everyone and even longer to get waters and creamer. When the food was brought out, it seemed only mine had an issue - it was the trifecta but such a small portion of eggs. We had ordered one scrambled egg as a side and that was even larger than the "two egg portion" that came with my plate.  I mentioned it to the waitress who brought out the food and she happily brought some more eggs (thank you for noticing).    All in all, it's a spot to go to but it probably won't be my first or second choice for a weekend breakfast. May be better during the week! No pictures of food since we were so hungry.

Vdy28O8muZuwWod9RCe6IA.text: Really glad to see we now have First Watch here as I've heard good things. I love a good breakfast/brunch so this was right up my alley. They do the yelp waitlist which is nice, so even during busy times you can go ahead and get your spot in line before arriving. Parking was plentiful here  when I visited.  We didn't really have much of a wait since we used the waitlist and were seated fairly quickly. We tried the seasonal juice which was amazing and I'd recommend. We also got the lemon ricotta pancakes, million dollar bacon, and the seasonal cornbread carnitas. The lemon ricotta pancakes were light and fluffy and well balanced with the lemon. The bacon was also very good. The carnitas lacked flavor so I wouldn't recommend this dish, but the others were great. Nice addition to the area.

7nnjNPo1hW_Mf2gXs6YB5Q.text: So I finally made it to First Watch for breakfast.  We must have gotten there during a slow spell because we were seated right away.   But by the time we left, there was clearly a bit of wait for a table.  Even with open tables, though, this place is LOUD.  And as the tables filled, it got louder.  So don't go here and expect to carry on a conversation without considerable difficulty.  (Note to owners:  Please consider adding some sound insulation.)  At first glance, the food was a bit more pricey than I usually want to spend for breakfast.  But once my crab omelet arrived at my table, I understood the prices:  it was stuffed with tons of crab meat.  The food was fresh and well prepared.  I'll be honest, the service could have been a little better.  There were stretches where I really needed some more napkins but our waitress was nowhere to be found.  Overall though, I was impressed.  The only thing that would really stop me from going back is the noise.

photos.caption: Photo of First Watch Providence - Charlotte, NC, United States. Trifecta
Photo of First Watch Providence - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Omelet
Photo of First Watch Providence - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast Bowl Options!

idngywMZV4nWJjq-yTSdTw.text: This place has now risen to the top of our Charlotte breakfast list. There just always seems to be something uniquely delicious on their seasonal menu which runs for a limited amount of time per season. This time two such options were the Lemon Blueberry Quinoa Pancakes and Smoked Salmon Tzatziki Toast.  The pancakes were loaded with fresh blueberries and accompanied by a berry compote and topped with granola and berry butter. They were perfectly fried a golden pbrown and absolutely delicious. I hope to order at least once more while they are still available on the spring menu.  The salmon toast was also excellent and beautifully plated along with two superbly prepared over easy eggs. Coffee was delicious and service was friendly and attentive. Nice extras that have become necessities, like raw sugar and fresh creme, are also readily provided. As always though, this place can be noisy.

photos.caption: Photo of First Watch Providence - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab omelet

Photo of First Watch Providence - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon Tsukiji toast

jFIJ7mlOdrvcxDuVMcu4SA.text: I came here for lunch with some co workers last week. This was my first time at this location. Every time i go to First Watch it is amazing. They have the best coffee in my opinion. I ordered their new summer menu item of the crab omelette. When the food came out to our table they brought the wrong item out for me. I understand restaurants make mistakes and this wasn't a big issue for me. It did take a little longer the wait for the corrected meal but the manager came over and apologized and said my meal was free. Once my food did some out it was delicious. It was my co workers first time there and they enjoyed it as well. I wish they were open later but I love it there!

2vBYFYdWeQJbxfFSyQ1gaA.text: Tried this place recently for the first time and it was amazing! It does seem to get pretty busy so either make a reservation or if you want to skip the wait they have a high table that is free to anyone who doesn't mind sitting with others. Food wise I thought it was all delicious. I high suggest coming in for a family or friend brunch meet up. Although I do wish that they had some mimosas and other types.

daop3GPRQIePDtr1ygJQ1g.text: Came in at 11 to a almost full restaurant.  Was told would be 10-15 minute wait which I was fine with.   5 minutes later was called to be seated.    Ordered the farm hash.  Pleasantly surprised with real hash not the standard fair of other restaurants.  Was delicious.    I can't wait to come back and try something else.  Highly recommend this place if your in the area.

YbJH1Kbv0y-rphvxd6xbHw.text: Recently visited with a friend and was a little disappointed with their egg benedict. I really liked their salmon egg benedict but it was not as good as before this time. Salmon was not fresh and the sauce was not enough. Hope they work on their popular egg benedict to retrieve original tastes.   The combo menu(any two choices of salad, soup or sandwich) is always a good deal! Sweet honey pecan salad is my favorite. Ham and gruyere melt sandwich is good too. Also I enjoyed their morning meditation fresh juice. Balanced well with beet and orange juice, can't taste strong ginger or turmeric. Want to try kale tonic juice next time!

r1CkuSCs-Qe0qERn1iJAEw.text: We had a pretty unpleasant experience here the other day after not coming by for a while. We arrived on Monday before noon and were seated outside right away. The host/manager(?) was very kind and set up our table well. It took a longggg time to be acknowledged by our waitress who came by and asked if we wanted coffee and then disappeared again. She came back  and seemed awkward and in a hurry. She took our food orders and we still didn't have water. We ordered and the food took a long while. My husband who had to get back to work was getting grumpy (it had been about 45 minutes by then) and of course as soon as the food came out our waitress dropped his plate on the ground (oops!). She was very sorry and said his food would be comped but his replacement food took a longggg time. I had finished my plate by then and it was very awkward. I don't think I'll be coming back for a while :(

mAw6D3x2V2JzP7d8EoMJlg.text: Today was my first time visiting first watch at waverly it was packed. The wait wasn't too long I sat at a community table ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes with the million dollar bacon. It was delicious wow! I know why they call it million dollar bacon it's that good. I love the ambiance it seemed very homey and had a great community vibe. It's a great place to go after church for breakfast and I would return again the service was excellent and there juices are all scratch-made.

photos.caption: Photo of First Watch Providence - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon ricotta pancakes
Photo of First Watch Providence - Charlotte, NC, United States. Million dollar bacon

93ifQEOiozAD8dkorQnDlg.text: We had a very good late breakfast at First Watch.  All of the menu options sounded great.  This is not your basic boring breakfast joint.  The selections are creative, well thought out, and well presented.    I had the biscuits and gravy with a side of the amazing bacon.  This was a "healthy" option in my mind because it was chicken sausage which I appreciated.  Honestly, the biscuit was fluffy and perfectly prepared.  It was not soggy when it arrived.  The gravy and scrambled eggs were also great.    Let's just say my wife and I arm wrestled for the last strip of bacon...  of course she won.  It was that good!  She had some sort of omelette which she loved.  I am sorry, I forgot to type but it looked great.  The service was friendly and attentive.  Portions were just right.  We had a great breakfast and look forward to many more!

yDvCi4ULNF5NXEpIA0w8Ng.text: I ate breakfast here recently and I was thoroughly impressed.  The food was absolutely delicious.  The farmhouse potatoes were fantastic, bacon cooked to perfection, sausage was incredible, and their toast was some if the best I've ever tasted.  The eggs were cooked to order and was also wonderful.  The service was great.  Very quick and efficient, promptly filling waters, milks and coffees when needed but no overbearing.  The staff were extremely friendly and polite, and knew their menu extremely well.  The restaurant is very cool inside --though can be a bit loud because of the industrial design.  It has a very clean and airy feel, and is very well maintained.  There is plenty of seating indoors and some great outdoor spots.  Lots of parking up front, easy in/out of main surrounding roads, and overall terrific experience.  Highly recommend.

X1DxZ7_WQoddktMse5AJ3A.text: It was just Ok.  We used the yelp waitlist which was spot on. Loved that! Ordered our food I got the eggs Benedict and my sister got some lemon pancakes.  She enjoyed hers. Mine was bland with no flavor. The server was mediocre to say the least.  My standards was high for this place as everyone I knew was bragging I felt disappointed

gHhmNV1F1Jjg_1qaTLPjig.text: First visit to First Watch and it was quite pleasant. We waited for less than 10 minutes before being seated. Our waitress was very sweet and helpful in assisting me in making a decision on what to order. I got the Monterey Club and I believe chicken tortilla or bean soup. Gosh darn it, I can't remember now but it was hot, well seasoned and hearty. Loved it! The club sandwich was just okay. Everything about was good except the turkey which unfortunately was the main component of the sandwich. It was just oddly mushy and no matter how delicious and crispy the bacon, it should couldn't compensate for the weird texture of the turkey.  I also one of their juices that was very delicious and an excellent price at $3.99. It was the morning meditation with orange, lemon, turmeric, organic ginger, agave nectar and beet. If you order anything to drink, get that. Highly refreshing with a nice clean taste. My friend enjoyed her farmhouse breakfast skillet, very hearty and filling. At least it appeared that way. You pay at the counter on your way out and the ladies there were very sweet as well. Thumbs up to the staff we encountered and thumbs up to all the food and drink minus the turkey meat.  Will definitely come back for the soup and the juice and maybe a different sandwich. Give this   That is all!

LzLDvs5Pgrvit-nffG1e0Q.text: There was a bit of a line so make sure to add your name on the list via Yelp. We got in immediately before about 6 other parties. I ordered the cold press juice that was super refreshing - I don't recall the name but it had beet and turmeric. We were starving and ordered some toast while we waited for the mains to be prepared. The toast was amazing - big thick cut multigrain slices pre buttered with a side of strawberry jam. Delicious. I got the egg sandwhich that came topped with smashed avocado, bacon and gruyere  served on a brioche bun. It was insanely good. Of course there was no way I could leave this establishment without trying the lemon ricotta pancakes so my husband and I got them to share - also an absolute must- fluffy pancakes riddled with ricotta topped with lemon cream (a little over powering) and strawberries. We will be returning soon.

f4w5wiPikX5p4v5WRBDQgg.text: It was bad start to finish. The food was good. The server was nice, but it didn't compensate for the fact that we waited 40 minutes for a table, while we watched 5 tables stand open, because the kitchen was so backed up. And I can account for that because we ordered as soon as we sat down and then waiting as we watched with a birds-eye view of the kitchen for 40 more minutes while nothing left. The server brought us toast to hold us over, while my son ate a left over half of an apple. The open  Tip: If you do choose to try this place, check in online and at least cut half of your expected hour wait.

tPXOVQ3F_trD4i2KpCvfkQ.text: Great little spot to grab brunch with friends or family! The staff is very friendly and the food is great as well.

photos.caption: Photo of First Watch Providence - Charlotte, NC, United States

m_QflnETwYVz5-7kNW2Lug.text: I generally do not enjoy a cooked breakfast. It's usually too heavy and sticks with me all day. I had heard so many good things about First Watch that I decided to give them a try despite my reservations. What a delightful surprise! This is one of the best breakfasts I've ever had and I will definitely be returning with all of my friends. This was our 2nd attempt to eat here, as our 1st attempt was on a weekend, but we were not willing to wait an hour! We returned on a Tuesday morning and were seated almost immediately. Our waiter was very helpful with the menu, and made sure we had our beverages while we perused the menu.  I started out with one of their fresh juices, and I can't remember the name of it but it had beat in it and was fantastic! For the main course I have the salmon and shallot frittata and it was a perfect melange of flavors without any being overpowering.   Another thing I really like is that they serve the eggs with a nice light salad instead of heavy potatoes and it really helps in keeping you from feeling overfull all morning. Having said that, if you want their potatoes you can substitute. We also ordered a side of their million dollar bacon and it was worth every penny. The combination of spice and sweet is sheer perfection.    I like the fact that our server watched our progression and brought the ticket at just the right time period we were able to check out when we were ready without having to wait to get a ticket. Over all, I highly recommend First Watch!

pwG-pZY1EpiJ4lCU6mBA-Q.text: The wait is always so long but the food is always so good! The juices blends are great too!

t8D-wJ9mDiXjkg-wT-guHA.text: There's something special about this place.  Ate at one in Texas, loved it, and then ate at this location and had the same great experience.  Breakfast recipes that are creative and so fantastic, well beyond anything I've ever had at other breakfast restaurants.  Highly recommend.

LxWE6gqC9VkmUR7HtlOipw.text: Amazing food! Love the skillets. Manager and owners eere excellent hosts! Great experience!

z9j5XtWt_TK2ZbzMeEeuBQ.text: Waverly location is far more pleasant than Matthews location!  Thank you Waverly for making us feel welcome!  Food was great, our server was very friendly!

Nro9gzL7YGKvnsb-nzQegg.text: Awesome food! Best place in NC so far for a solid breakfast/brunch. Service was quick and helpful.

y6lkyNjX4Fy2F6O6Ggsfag.text: Great food!!!!!! Very fresh so much flavor.  I wanted to eat everything lol.  Very nice staff and very efficient.  I wish they were open longer they will definitely give Panera a run for the money.  I love Panera but this place the pancakes and grits are unbelievable!!!!

wSw5BWT2ByQ_3ngXiLumSQ.text: Have eaten at First Watch in Boca Raton and Scottsdale.   Everything is consistent: - great food especially their special bacon - meticulous service - caring attitude - nice atmosphere - a little pricey

AVJHeLX4pP-W9ipUWSOlNQ.text: Probably the best breakfast I've had in Charlotte.  High quality food well prepared.   I'll be back very soon to explore other items on the menu.

XAtFJexoQ9v7byG4kvqM0g.text: I relocated to the Land O Lakes area from Atlanta and was so happy to come across First Watch by my new home in Lutz, FL.  I treated myself on a non busy Wednesday at 1:30 and asked to be seated outside.  I sat for 15 minutes and NO SERVICE.  Walked inside, stood at the register while 2 employees fussed back and forth about an order mix up before they walked off without acknowledging me.  Literally stood at the front for another 5-7 minutes before another employee walked up and asked if I was ready to 'cash out'.  I can only imagine the look on my face.  The ABSOLUTE WORST SERVICE!!!! Save yourself the frustration and go to a different location if you plan on eating.  So disappointed!

AbzvckVi7OPunpSR8RI9zg.text: Food is always delicious, fresh and healthy! Love this location and the people who work here. A++

QWkZqYZi2vwqD3aWaLZZeA.text: This was our second time visiting. Although mid morning, still a long wait for a weekday. Received our order fairly quickly however my "poached eggs" came out hard boiled and the avocado on my sandwich was the size of a lemon rind in your tea. The salad was a few 4 bites of mixed greens tossed in a very, very small amount of lemon and olive oil. They took back the order and 20 min later, after my friends were finished with their breakfast brought me now undercooked eggs (the whites were dripping and  bright yolk visible- not at all poached). When I hesitated to accept the new plate, my friends reinforced what I was seeing and said, "you can't eat that/ they are definitely not cooked." The waiter proceeded to say, "you didn't want them hard boiled- right?" I said...no- I didn't want them hard boiled. But I can not eat raw eggs either." At that point, I asked to just take them back- I didn't want to delay my friends any longer. He proceeded to bring me a check with my $3.13 coffee charge- tacky after I sat and watched my friends eat- to absorb the cost of the coffee would have been expected. Portions also significantly smaller than when they first opened. We will be finding a new brunch spot. Will not return.

CkqpAbqKO4zXQJUfijZqDg.text: My family of 3 waited for a table for 50 minutes though we were quoted 30.  The app they sent me a link to that showed my place in line actually showed us moving DOWN the wait list rather than UP!  The restaurant was extremely noisy and crowded.  It was not a comfortable wait.  Once we were seated, we found the table to be dirty with dripping beads of moisture on all of the glassware.  When I brought this to management's attention, I was discounted.  We decided to leave and go to eat elsewhere.  I can guarantee we will never set foot in this loud, obnoxious restaurant again.  I have been to First Watch on many occasions in Cincinnati with much quieter and roomy spaces--not to mention more professional staff.  Shame on you for tarnishing the First Watch reputation.

kKaNVkGeTOKjfB4Q2J4c3A.text: The service was exceptional and food was very tasty!! be sure to try the lemon ricotta pancakes, they are so good!

EHYJmvcJopb1jzjYBouFDA.text: The Food is good but the Table turnaround is terrible. I witnessed several tables waiting to get bussed. Meanwhile, people were leaving because they were being told it was an hour - two hour wait. Staff could do a better job moving people through.

I9W8KEGUNkGe42L5xmyeAg.text: This is the second attempt at this restaurant....from the outside and inside, very cute, trendy.....food was terrible.....how can you screw eggs up?  Mine were dried up and overdone, the potatoes were AWFUL - they were sooo SALTY and tasted like they were cooked in something, but couldn't put my finger on it...the "artisan" toast was this multigrain toast that had ZERO flavor and dry as a bone....  Service was slow....honestly, if this is considered good food, I met as well leave the planet.   Save your money....go elsewhere, anywhere!

89aJvVp26BVB_2weaR-ZCg.text: Clean, good service, food is worth the hour long wait! We ordered the half roast beef & broccoli cheese soup and the tri athlete. That roast beef and soup were some of the best I've ever had. And the morning mediation juice is perfect!

0oeJvm3DQtMi4X72Qab-ZA.text: Had a much better experience the second time. Food was good. No raw sausage this time. Service was excellent. I do recommend checking in on the app as wait times are crazy on the weekends. Front of the house staff seemed a little overwhelmed checking people in.

jMbB6N7eMboU_6qkWK07rA.text: Very good food and friendly sevice, by far the best place we've eaten for breakfast. Food came out fast.

fwvrFpbj-FWN7XTX1yVPgw.text: Went to the one in Hampton, VA. Food was ok but customer service was horrible. Likely won't visit again.

P1GMuKqKNwwFfmx2oKa49g.text: Excellent food and service! This is our new favorite breakfast restaurant. We had the Elote Mexican Street Corn Hash - AMAZING! We also sampled the juices from their juice bar - the Kale Tonic and Morning Meditation juice were both wonderful!

dHnqGMYZd5WzmTFWo5Y_Uw.text: Great healthy breakfast and lunch menu. The omelettes were excellent.  Limited seating but worth the wait.

XdZ1SzhJrnmmU8sgochDnw.text: I love First Watch! I'm on a strict diet and they are always able to accommodate. Everything I've tried is delicious. The people who work here are very helpful and friendly. And their coffee is the BEST!

zRxl1pmIS2IMimSj8UNqNA.text: I give them 1 star because I have to in order to leave a review. Worst experience ever.. After their mistake in seating our party I questioned what was going on. The hostess Branden(SP?) informed me .. not to get hasty.. I could either deal with the wait or leave.. wow..  have spoken to the owner , reaching out to corporate.. they have a reputation for decent food and horrible service.. see they are living up to their reputation .

sWc-PjFxHUckB3LQ7eaijw.text: Our absolute favorite breakfast place.   The menu offers incredible variety.  You can go traditional or try one of their more creative options (something I highly recommend).  Everything is always super fresh and having healthy options that are also delicious makes eating better a breeze.   The service is great.   The dining area always clean and inviting.  You just can't go wrong with taking your family and friends out for a great meal.

ib9TrRIfUi4HnI9oq3PJQg.text: I've heard great things about the concept. And I'm sure they are excellent. Today it was very off. Food was delivered luke warm to cold. Overall just off.

OqL1vrziGHxzH_7gGwoXow.text: Ridiculous wait times and management will take the call aheads before actual walk ins.  So basically if you are here first you are screwed!  We were told our wait time was 45 min.   After 40 min we were then told there are 8 call aheads in front of us.  Ridiculous!!  I'd rather give my business somewhere else

-q2AB4ejK6O6vRw5WEb98g.text: Everything is always so fresh! They need a better system for people waiting; the doorway is always blocked.

UMK2vj8NRMbGpoSN3Q7bFg.text: Making food and such a great atmosphere here. Every time we eat at this restaurant it's a great experience from the start to finish, food, staff, the whole shebang! Definitely recommend this place!

Zdc-fDdWRlTLPz5l_2PlBQ.text: I went there the other day and it will be the first and last time . The dishes where diry , my coffee cup had lipstick on it . My water glass was spotty . The service felt rush   .

P8Vy4t8C_q37MPexetMH3g.text: The food was phenomenal. Both my mom and I thoroughly enjoyed the meal, it was cooked perfectly and had great flavor. However, the service was extremely disappointing. We got there at 8am, and then it took 15 minutes for anyone to come by after we were seated. Then, after we finally got our order placed, it took 20 minutes for it to come. After we got the food, we didn't see our waitress again for a long while. It was only getting busy when we were leaving, so I'm not sure why it took so long.

2jXpZPnIJ59MQbEcthibBg.text: Food is always good.  Enjoyed the Asian Pork Belly breakfast bowl.  Service, on the other hand, is horrid.  It took them 10 minutes to acknowledge our presence.  Another 10 to get drinks ordered for the table, another 5 to get coffee.... and still another 5 to get water.  waitress was super nice, but the delays are horrible.  Hire more help or space your seating out a little more.

IFI2AFwL_h7JXhWzMt0utA.text: Horrible service by our waiter Bobby this morning.  He was VERY rude never came back to check on us.  Was EXTREMELY snarky.

N1CyEsIFuNcrxCDPgYtSwA.text: We love that you can come in and try something new and it is always good!  A great farm to table feel and great people that work there!  Our kiddo loves it!  It is a small restaurant so you can wait a bit especially on the weekend!

EQ1BWlx4h5gkU9TXG2WhOA.text: Great breakfast. Healthy options. Be ready to wait as it is a new concept there is always a wait. I recommend the community table as an alternative. West coast yumminess in Charlotte!

D9h0UWDeCyGyukgBRlLskQ.text: Great b'fast/brunch spot. Something 4 everyone. The sausage - which I eat rarely- is to die for.

JEXaMAKd2ciadcMfEICZ6g.text: The food is really good and really fresh. They have long wait times, though. This is due to the slow service. However, if it's a party of 1 or 2, try sitting at the community table and meeting some new people. The slow service which leads to long wait times is literally the only downside.

cPEPP3iICUIY9Ckh3OQ_8g.text: The lemon ricotta pancakes were amazing. I also had their take on juevos rancheros which was v good. They coat the tortilla in egg instead of egg in it. It's so different and tasty.  Another guest had a delicious looking salad that I will need to try next time. Weird that you have to go out of your way to pay bill.  Good service

LKzcolEqxnHnejfcdSTkzw.text: First time here with a party of 12....so impressed. We've been waiting for this place to open and were not disappointed. Great serving staff, excellent food...no reservations, so get in line via app. Two thumbs up - we'll be back.

kUFMr8eQqOKiw5q3VuS31Q.text: Went for an early morning breakfast on Friday. This is a higher end spot with a lot of creative options on the menu. I really enjoyed the breakfast tacos, highly recommend! Prices are fair to the portions you get.

IJK0YIFn4MRBwPrPgKAggQ.text: Great coffee, the carrot cake pancake was to die for! Love the decor, wait staff was very accommodating. I will definitely go back. On the negative it was pretty loud in there. Maybe add some upholstery?
